habitat_description: The Columbian Ground Squirrel (Urocitellus columbianus)  occurs in Oregon, Washington, Idaho, Montana and portions of Canada.  It inhabits open habitat at a variety of elevations but is intolerant of dry conditions (NatureServe 2015).  Suitable land cover types include high grass plateaus, sagebrush plains, valley grasslands, openings in coniferous forests (including clearcuts and meadows), alpine meadows, and stream banks (NatureServer 2015).   N. Tarr, 10February2015.
